classes.name: BB_cut
classes.brief:
Bonmin BCP cutting plane interface

Cutting plane interface for Bonmin integrated with BCP framework.
Experimental: combines branch-cut-price with MINLP solving.

classes.name: BM
classes.brief:
Bonmin BCP main interface

Main interface for experimental Bonmin-BCP integration.
Combines branch-cut-price parallel framework with MINLP.

classes.name: BONMIN_ReferenceManual
classes.brief:
Bonmin Doxygen documentation main page

Main page for Bonmin reference manual. Provides overview of Mixed
Integer Nonlinear Programming solver combining B&B with Ipopt NLP.

classes.name: BonAmplInterface
BonAmplSetup
classes.brief:
AMPL-specific Bonmin setup and initialization

Extends BonminSetup to initialize from AMPL command-line arguments
and .nl files. Handles reading options and model from AMPL.

**Initialization methods:**
- initialize(argv): Read from command line and files
- initialize(argv, opt_content, nl_content): Read from strings (for Bcp)
- fillOsiInterface(): Initialize existing interface from strings

classes.name: BonAmplTMINLP
classes.brief:
AMPL interface for MINLP problems via .nl files

Implements TMINLP by reading AMPL .nl files, extracting integer variable
information, SOS constraints, branching priorities, and convexity markers.

**AMPL suffix reading:**
- read_priorities(): Variable branching priorities
- read_sos(): SOS1/SOS2 constraint definitions
- read_convexities(): Constraint convexity markers (for OA)
- read_onoff(): Perspective reformulation indicators
- read_obj_suffixes(): Upper bounding objective (UBObj prefix)

**AMPL solve_result_num codes:**
- 3: Integer optimal
- 220: Proven infeasible
- 421: Limit reached with feasible solution
- 410: Limit reached, no feasible solution
- 500: Error

classes.name: BonArraysHelpers
classes.brief:
Array resize and copy utilities for Bonmin
Copyright (C) International Business Machines Corporation 2007.
All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

Template functions for resizing arrays while preserving content:
- resizeAndCopyArray: Resize and copy up to min(old,new) elements
- resizeAndCopyArray with capacity: Only reallocate if needed

Authors: Pierre Bonami, IBM
Date: October 6, 2007

classes.name: BonAuxInfos
classes.brief:
Auxiliary information passing between Bonmin B&B components

Extends OsiBabSolver to pass solver-specific information during
branch-and-cut, including NLP solutions found by heuristics.

**Key functionality:**
- nlpSolution_: Store solutions from NLP solves/heuristics
- infeasibleNode_: Flag for cut generator detected infeasibility
- bestSolution2_: Alternate objective tracking (for bi-objective)

**Usage pattern:**
Cut generators and heuristics store found solutions here;
the B&B framework queries for incumbents.

classes.name: BonBabInfos
classes.brief:
Information passing between Bonmin B&B components

Extends OsiAuxInfo to pass Bonmin-specific information between components
during branch-and-cut. Provides access to the Bab solver and solution info.

**Key functionality:**
- babPtr_: Access to the Bab object (and via it, CbcModel)
- hasSolution(): Check if incumbent exists
- bestSolution_: Current best known solution (from AuxInfo)

Used by cut generators and heuristics to query current B&B state.

classes.name: BonBabSetupBase
classes.brief:
Base configuration class for branch-and-bound MINLP solvers

Aggregates all components needed to run branch-and-bound: NLP solver,
cut generators, heuristics, branching rules, and tree traversal strategy.
Serves as the central configuration point for Bonmin algorithms.

**Key components:**
- nonlinearSolver_: OsiTMINLPInterface for NLP subproblems
- cutGenerators_: List of CglCutGenerator (OA, ECP, Gomory, etc.)
- heuristics_: List of CbcHeuristic (feasibility pump, rounding, etc.)
- branchingMethod_: OsiChooseVariable for variable selection

**Tree search strategies:**
- NodeComparison: bestBound, DFS, BFS, dynamic, bestGuess
- TreeTraversal: HeapOnly, DiveFromBest, ProbedDive, DfsDiveFromBest

**Branching strategies (VarSelectStra_Enum):**
- MOST_FRACTIONAL: Simple, fast, often poor
- STRONG_BRANCHING: Evaluate candidates via LP/NLP solves
- RELIABILITY_BRANCHING: Use pseudo-costs when trusted

classes.name: BonBonminSetup
classes.brief:
Main Bonmin algorithm configuration and initialization

Extends BabSetupBase with Bonmin-specific algorithm selection and
initialization for all MINLP algorithms.

**Algorithm enum:**
- B_BB (0): NLP-based branch-and-bound
- B_OA (1): Pure Outer Approximation decomposition
- B_QG (2): Quesada-Grossmann branch-and-cut
- B_Hyb (3): Hybrid OA with NLP at nodes (default)
- B_Ecp (4): Extended Cutting Plane (FilMINT-style)
- B_IFP (5): Iterated Feasibility Pump

**Initialization:**
- initializeBBB(): Pure B&B with NLP at every node
- initializeBHyb(): Hybrid with OA cuts + occasional NLP

classes.name: BonBoundsReader
classes.brief:
Reader for variable bound modification files
Copyright (C) Carnegie Mellon University 2005. All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

BoundsReader: Reads files containing variable bound changes in
MPS-like format. Applies bound modifications to OsiTMINLPInterface
for scenario analysis or user-specified bound tightening.

Authors: Pierre Bonami, Carnegie Mellon University
Date: May 26, 2005

classes.name: BonBqpdSolver
classes.brief:
Interface to BQPD quadratic programming solver
Copyright (C) International Business Machines Corporation, 2007.
All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

BqpdSolver: TNLPSolver implementation wrapping the BQPD Fortran solver
for solving quadratic programs during strong branching. Provides hot
start capability for efficient re-optimization with changed bounds.

Uses BranchingTQP to create QP approximations of the MINLP.

Authors: Andreas Waechter, IBM (based on BonFilterSolver.cpp)
Date: July 9, 2007

classes.name: BonBqpdWarmStart
classes.brief:
Warm start information for BQPD solver
Copyright (C) International Business Machines Corporation 2007.
All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

BqpdWarmStart: Stores warm start information for BQPD QP solver.
Inherits from both CoinWarmStartPrimalDual (actual warm start data)
and CoinWarmStartBasis (for Cbc integration compatibility).

Authors: Andreas Waechter, IBM (based on BonFilterWarmStart.hpp)
Date: August 3, 2007

classes.name: BonBranchingTQP
classes.brief:
QP adapter for strong branching in MINLP
Copyright (C) International Business Machines Corporation and
Carnegie Mellon University 2006, 2008. All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

classes.name: BonCbc
classes.brief:
Main branch-and-bound driver for Bonmin using Cbc

The Bab class is the entry point for solving MINLPs with Bonmin. It wraps
CbcModel to provide branch-and-bound with NLP solvers for subproblems.

**Key method:**
- branchAndBound(BabSetupBase&): Main solve routine

**Return statuses (MipStatuses):**
- FeasibleOptimal: Optimal solution found and proven
- ProvenInfeasible: Problem proven infeasible
- Feasible: Integer solution found (not proven optimal)
- UnboundedOrInfeasible: Continuous relaxation unbounded
- NoSolutionKnown: No feasible solution found

**Solution access:**
- bestSolution(): Primal solution vector
- bestObj(): Objective value of best solution
- bestBound(): Best known lower bound

classes.name: BonCbcLpStrategy
classes.brief:
Cbc strategy for configuring cut generators in OA
Copyright (C) Carnegie Mellon University 2006. All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

CbcStrategyChooseCuts: Strategy class extending CbcStrategyDefault
to configure cut generators (Gomory, MIR, etc.) for use in Outer
Approximation LP subproblems. Sets generator frequencies based on
BabSetupBase configuration.

Authors: Pierre Bonami, Carnegie Mellon University
Date: March 15, 2006

classes.name: BonCbcNlpStrategy
classes.brief:
NLP failure handling strategy for Cbc in MINLP context
Copyright (C) International Business Machines Corporation and
Carnegie Mellon University 2006. All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

CbcNlpStrategy: Strategy class for handling NLP solve failures during
branch-and-bound. Tracks consecutive failures and infeasibilities,
optionally treating failures as infeasible to continue search.

Authors: John J. Forrest, IBM; Pierre Bonami, CMU
Date: March 15, 2006

classes.name: BonCbcNode
classes.brief:
Extended node information classes for MINLP branch-and-bound

Extends Cbc's node information to track MINLP-specific data like sequences
of infeasible or unsolved subproblems along a branch.

**Classes:**
- BonCbcFullNodeInfo: Complete node recreation from scratch
- BonCbcPartialNodeInfo: Incremental node changes from parent

**MINLP-specific tracking:**
- sequenceOfInfeasiblesSize_: Consecutive infeasible NLP subproblems
- sequenceOfUnsolvedSize_: Consecutive NLP solver failures

These counts help detect problematic branches where NLP solves consistently
fail, enabling early pruning heuristics to avoid wasted computation.

classes.name: BonChooseVariable
classes.brief:
Strong branching and pseudo-cost based variable selection for MINLP

Implements branching variable selection for nonlinear branch-and-bound.
Combines strong branching (solving LP/NLP relaxations) with pseudo-costs
(estimates from historical branching information).

**Key classes:**
- BonChooseVariable: Main branching decision maker (extends OsiChooseVariable)
- HotInfo: Stores strong branching results for a candidate

**Branching decision process:**
1. setupList(): Identify fractional variables, rank by pseudo-costs
2. doStrongBranching(): Evaluate top candidates via LP/NLP solves
3. chooseVariable(): Select best candidate based on objective change

**Pseudo-cost computation:**
- Estimates objective change per unit change in variable value
- Updated after each branching decision using actual results
- Used to avoid expensive strong branching after trust is established

classes.name: BonColReader
classes.brief:
Reader for AMPL .col and .row name files
Copyright (C) Carnegie Mellon University 2005. All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

NamesReader: Reads variable and constraint names from AMPL-generated
.col (column names) and .row (row names) files. Provides bidirectional
lookup between indices and names via hash map.

Authors: Pierre Bonami, Carnegie Mellon University
Date: May 26, 2005

classes.name: BonCurvBranchingSolver
classes.brief:
Curvature-based branching solver (DEPRECATED)
Copyright (C) 2006, 2007 International Business Machines Corporation.
All Rights Reserved.

CurvBranchingSolver: Strong branching solver that uses curvature
estimation to predict bound changes. Uses second-order information
from the Hessian to guide variable selection.

NOTE: This code is no longer supported.

classes.name: BonCurvatureEstimator
classes.brief: Curvature estimation for branching decisions (NOT SUPPORTED)

classes.name: BonCutStrengthener
classes.brief:
Strengthening OA cuts via NLP optimization

Improves outer approximation cuts by solving auxiliary NLPs to find
tighter bounds on linearizations. Also supports disjunctive cuts.

classes.name: BonDiver
classes.brief:
Diving-based tree traversal strategies for MINLP branch-and-bound

Implements tree traversal strategies that "dive" down branches before
backtracking, often finding feasible solutions faster than pure best-bound.

classes.name: BonDummyHeuristic
classes.brief:
Simple placeholder heuristic wrapping NLP solver

This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

DummyHeuristic: Minimal heuristic that calls NLP solver to provide
solutions. Used for testing or as template for new heuristics.
Always reports ready to run (shouldHeurRun returns true).

Authors: Pierre Bonami, Carnegie Mellon University
Date: May 26, 2005

classes.name: BonDummyPump
classes.brief:
Placeholder/testing heuristic for feasibility pump

This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

DummyPump: Simple placeholder heuristic extending LocalSolverBasedHeuristic.
Used for testing or as template for new heuristics.

Provides minimal implementation of solution() method.

Authors: Pierre Bonami, LIF Université de la Méditerranée-CNRS
Date: 06/18/2008

classes.name: BonEcpCuts
classes.brief:
Extended Cutting Plane (ECP) cut generator for MINLP

Generates OA cuts iteratively at LP solution points, refining the
linear approximation without requiring NLP solves at every iteration.

classes.name: BonExitCodes
classes.brief:
Error codes for uncatchable errors in Bonmin

Defines error codes for fatal errors that cannot be handled via exceptions.

**Error codes:**

- UNSUPPORTED_CBC_OBJECT: CbcObject type not supported by Bonmin

classes.name: BonFilterSolver

classes.name: BonFilterTypes

Fortran type definitions for FilterSQP interface

Defines type aliases for interfacing with the Fortran FilterSQP library.
Uses FORTRAN_INTEGER_TYPE from Ipopt's configuration for portability
across different Fortran compilers (32-bit vs 64-bit integers).

classes.name: BonFilterWarmStart
classes.brief:
Warm start storage for FilterSQP solver

Stores warm start information for FilterSQP, including primal/dual values
and FilterSQP's internal lws (integer working set) array. Inherits from both
CoinWarmStartPrimalDual and CoinWarmStartBasis for Cbc compatibility.

**Data stored:**
- x: Primal variables (from CoinWarmStartPrimalDual)
- lam: Dual multipliers (from CoinWarmStartPrimalDual)
- lws: FilterSQP's integer working set array (active set info)
- istat[14]: FilterSQP status array

**Classes:**
- FilterWarmStart: Main warm start container
- FilterWarmStartDiff: Differential update for tree traversal

classes.name: BonFixAndSolveHeuristic
classes.brief: Fix-and-Solve heuristic for MINLP

classes.name: BonFpForMinlp
classes.brief:
Feasibility Pump for MINLP via Outer Approximation

This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

MinlpFeasPump: Feasibility Pump implementation for MINLP using OA
decomposition. Alternates between solving MIP with distance-to-integer
objective and NLP with fixed integers to find feasible solutions.

classes.name: BonGuessHeuristic
classes.brief:
Pseudocost-based initial guess heuristic for MINLP

This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

classes.name: BonHeuristicDive
classes.brief: Base class for diving heuristics in MINLP

NLP-based diving heuristic selecting most fractional variable

MIP-based diving heuristic selecting by constraint participation

classes.brief:
NLP-based diving heuristic selecting by constraint participation

classes.name: BonHeuristicFPump
classes.brief:
Feasibility Pump heuristic for MINLP

Implements the Feasibility Pump algorithm adapted for nonlinear problems.
Alternates between:
1. Rounding to nearest integer solution
2. Projecting back to feasible continuous space via NLP

**Classes:**
- HeuristicFPump: Main feasibility pump heuristic (CbcHeuristic)
- RoundingFPump: Helper for intelligent rounding considering constraints

classes.name: BonHeuristicInnerApproximation
classes.brief:
Bonmin inner approximation heuristic for MINLP

Primal heuristic using inner approximation of feasible region.
Generates feasible MINLP solutions from LP relaxations.

classes.name: BonHeuristicLocalBranching
classes.brief: Local Branching heuristic for MINLP improvement

classes.name: BonHeuristicRINS
classes.brief: Relaxation Induced Neighborhood Search (RINS) heuristic for MINLP

classes.name: BonIpoptInteriorWarmStarter
classes.brief:
Interior point warm start for Ipopt in branch-and-bound

Stores interior point iterates from a solved NLP for warm starting child
nodes. Unlike simple optimal-point warm start, this preserves barrier
parameter (mu) and interior structure, enabling faster convergence.

**Key methods:**
- UpdateStoredIterates(): Called during optimization to save promising iterates
- WarmStartIterate(): Computes initial point for new problem from stored data
- Finalize(): Post-processing after parent NLP solve completes

**Stored data per iterate:**
- Primal/dual iterate vectors
- Barrier parameter mu
- NLP error, primal/dual infeasibility, complementarity

classes.name: BonIpoptSolver
classes.brief: Ipopt implementation of TNLPSolver for NLP subproblems

classes.name: BonIpoptWarmStart
classes.brief:
Warm start storage for Ipopt within branch-and-bound

Stores primal and dual solution values for warm starting subsequent NLP
solves. Inherits from both CoinWarmStartPrimalDual (for actual data) and
CoinWarmStartBasis (for Cbc integration compatibility).

**Data layout (dual part has 2*n + m values):**
- [0, n): Dual multipliers for lower bounds (z_L for x >= l)
- [n, 2n): Dual multipliers for upper bounds (z_U for x <= u)
- [2n, 2n+m): Dual multipliers for constraints (lambda for g(x))

**Classes:**
- IpoptWarmStart: Main warm start container
- IpoptWarmStartDiff: Differential update for tree traversal

classes.name: BonLinearCutsGenerator
classes.brief:
Composite cut generator managing multiple linear cut generators
Copyright (C) International Business Machines Corporation 2007.
All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

classes.name: BonLocalSolverBasedHeuristic
classes.brief: Base class for heuristics using local NLP/MINLP solves

classes.name: BonLpBranchingSolver
classes.brief:
LP-based strong branching solver using ECP cuts

Implements strong branching by solving LP relaxations enhanced with
Extended Cutting Plane (ECP) cuts, avoiding full NLP solves.

classes.name: BonMilpRounding
classes.brief: MILP-based rounding heuristic for MINLP

classes.name: BonMsgUtils
classes.brief:
Message utilities and macros for Bonmin

Provides ADD_MSG macro and message ID functions for standard,

classes.name: BonNWayChoose
classes.brief:
Bonmin N-way branching choice

N-way branching variable selection for robot path planning.
Experimental: selects among multiple branching candidates.

classes.name: BonNWayObject

Bonmin N-way branching object

N-way branching object for robot planning applications.
Creates multi-way branches instead of binary left/right.

classes.name: BonOACutGenerator2
classes.brief:
Classical Outer Approximation cut generator for MINLP

Implements the standard OA algorithm of Duran & Grossmann (1986) for convex
MINLP. Generates linearization cuts by Taylor expansion of nonlinear
constraints at NLP solutions.

classes.name: BonOAMessages
classes.brief:
Message definitions for Outer Approximation algorithms
Copyright (C) Carnegie Mellon University 2006. All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

Defines message IDs and OaMessages class for output during
Outer Approximation cutting plane algorithms. Messages include
NLP solve status, bound updates, and iteration statistics.

Authors: Pierre Bonami, Carnegie Mellon University
Date: July 15, 2005

classes.name: BonOaDecBase
classes.brief:
Base class for Outer Approximation (OA) decomposition algorithms

Implements the foundation for OA-based MINLP algorithms. OA iterates between
solving MILP subproblems and NLP subproblems, generating linear outer
approximations of the nonlinear constraints.

**OA algorithm outline:**
1. Solve MILP relaxation → get integer solution x*
2. Fix integers to x*, solve NLP → get nonlinear solution y*
3. Generate linearization cuts at y* (gradient-based)
4. Add cuts to MILP, repeat until convergence

**Key components:**
- solverManip: RAII helper to save/restore solver state
- performOa(): Virtual method implementing specific OA variant
- post_nlp_solve(): Handle NLP solution and update bounds

**Parameters:**
- global_: Add cuts globally (valid at all nodes)
- addOnlyViolated_: Only add cuts violated by current solution
- maxLocalSearch_: Limit on local search iterations

classes.name: BonOaFeasChecker
classes.brief:
OA-based feasibility checker for MILP solutions

Checks if MILP solution is feasible for original MINLP by evaluating
nonlinear constraints and generating OA/Benders cuts if infeasible.

classes.name: BonOaNlpOptim
classes.brief:
NLP-based outer approximation cut generator

Generates OA cuts by solving NLP relaxations at B&B nodes, rather than
at integer feasible points (as in classical OA). More expensive per cut,
but can improve bounds at fractional nodes.

classes.name: BonOsiTMINLPInterface
classes.brief: OsiSolverInterface wrapper for TMINLP problems

classes.name: BonOuterApprox
classes.brief:
Concrete outer approximation extractor for MINLP

Builds linear outer approximations of nonlinear constraints by
linearizing at a given point (typically NLP solution).

classes.name: BonOuterDescription
classes.brief:
Bonmin outer approximation description for convex MINLP

Outer approximation (OA) cut management for MINLP.
Linearization-based approach for convex MINLP.

classes.name: BonPseudoCosts
classes.brief:
Pseudo-cost storage and update for MINLP branching

Extends OsiPseudoCosts to track branching history for integer variables.
Pseudo-costs estimate the objective change per unit change in a variable,
enabling efficient branching decisions without expensive strong branching.

classes.name: BonPumpForMinlp
classes.brief:
Feasibility Pump heuristic adapted for MINLP
Copyright (C) CNRS
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

PumpForMinlp: Feasibility Pump heuristic for nonlinear mixed-integer
programming. Extends the MIP Feasibility Pump to handle nonlinear
constraints by using NLP subproblem solves.

Alternates between:
- Rounding current NLP solution to integer
- Solving NLP with objective minimizing distance to rounded point

Authors: Pierre Bonami, LIF Université de la Méditerranée-CNRS
Date: 02/18/2009

classes.name: BonQpBranchingSolver
classes.brief:
QP-based strong branching solver

Implements strong branching by solving QP approximations of the NLP
subproblems. Faster than full NLP but more accurate than LP.

classes.name: BonQuadCut
classes.brief:
Quadratic cutting plane for MINLP
Copyright (C) International Business Machines Corporation 2007.
All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

QuadCut: Extends OsiRowCut to include quadratic term x'Qx.
Stores c + ax + x'Qx with upper/lower storage modes for Q.

Cuts: Collection class extending OsiCuts to manage QuadCut objects
alongside standard linear cuts.

Authors: Pierre Bonami, IBM
Date: October 6, 2007

classes.name: BonQuadRow
classes.brief:
Quadratic row storage for NLP solver interface
Copyright (C) International Business Machines Corporation 2007.
All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

QuadRow: Stores quadratic constraint l < c + ax + x'Qx < u with
efficient gradient and Hessian evaluation. Provides methods for
NLP solver interface: eval_f, eval_grad, eval_hessian.

Can be initialized from QuadCut or linear OsiRowCut.

Authors: Pierre Bonami, IBM
Date: October 6, 2007

classes.name: BonRandomChoice
classes.brief:
Random variable selection for branching
Copyright (C) CNRS 2008. All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

BonRandomChoice: Variable selection strategy that randomly picks from
unsatisfied integer variables. Useful for diversification in search
or as baseline for comparison with sophisticated selection rules.

Authors: Pierre Bonami, LIF, CNRS-Marseille Universites
Date: March 17, 2008

classes.name: BonRegisteredOptions
classes.brief:
Extended option registration with algorithm validity tracking

Extends Ipopt's RegisteredOptions to track which options are valid for
which Bonmin algorithms, enabling algorithm-specific option filtering.

**Algorithm validity bits (ExtraOptInfosBits):**
- validInHybrid (1): B-Hyb algorithm
- validInQG (2): Quesada-Grossmann B-QG
- validInOA (4): Pure outer approximation B-OA
- validInBBB (8): Pure NLP-based branch-and-bound B-BB
- validInEcp (16): Extended cutting plane B-Ecp
- validIniFP (32): Iterated feasibility pump B-iFP
- validInCbc (64): Cbc parallel mode

**Category types (ExtraCategoriesInfo):**
- BonminCategory, IpoptCategory, FilterCategory, BqpdCategory, CouenneCategory

classes.name: BonSolReader

Reader for AMPL .sol solution files

SolReader: Reads solution files in AMPL .sol format containing

Authors: Pierre Bonami, LIF, CNRS
Date: March 1, 2011

classes.name: BonSolverHelp
classes.brief:
Utility functions for OA and Feasibility Pump algorithms

All Rights Reserved.

Helper functions for manipulating solver state during OA decomposition

Date: December 7, 2006

classes.name: BonStartPointReader

Reader for Ipopt initialization point files

StartPointReader: Reads .initP files containing starting point
information for Ipopt initialization. File format is: number of
primals, number of duals, then values. Variables ordered as:

classes.name: BonStdInterfaceTMINLP
classes.brief:
C-callback based TMINLP implementation for standard interface

This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

StdInterfaceTMINLP: TMINLP implementation using C function pointers
for callbacks (eval_f, eval_g, eval_grad_f, etc.). Enables use of
Bonmin from C or languages with C FFI. Mirrors Ipopt's StdCInterface.

Date: June 7, 2015

classes.name: BonStrongBranchingSolver
classes.brief: Abstract base class for strong branching NLP solves

classes.name: BonSubMipSolver
classes.brief:
Unified interface for solving MILP subproblems in OA decomposition

Provides a common interface for solving MILP subproblems using either
Cbc (via OsiClpSolverInterface) or CPLEX (via OsiCpxSolverInterface).
Used by OA decomposition algorithms to solve the linearized master problem.

classes.name: BonTMINLP
classes.brief: Base class for Mixed-Integer Nonlinear Programs (MINLP)

classes.name: BonTMINLP2OsiLP
classes.brief:
Abstract transformer from MINLP to LP outer approximation

Base class for building linear outer approximations of nonlinear problems.
Used to create MILP relaxations for OA-based algorithms.

**Key methods:**
- extract(): Build initial OA in an OsiSolverInterface
- get_oas(): Generate OA cuts at a given point
- get_refined_oa(): Get refined OA cuts

**Coefficient cleaning (cleanNnz):**
Small coefficients are handled specially to avoid numerical issues:
- Values < very_tiny_: Ignored completely
- Values < tiny_: Try to absorb into RHS if bounds allow

classes.name: BonTMINLP2Quad
classes.brief:
TMINLP2TNLP extension supporting quadratic cuts
Copyright (C) International Business Machines Corporation 2007.
All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

TMINLP2TNLPQuadCuts: Extends TMINLP2TNLP to handle quadratic cuts
in the NLP subproblem. Manages adding/removing cuts, updating
Jacobian and Hessian structures, and evaluating cut contributions.

Supports both linear (OsiRowCut) and quadratic (QuadCut) cuts.

Authors: Pierre Bonami, IBM
Date: October 6, 2007

classes.name: BonTMINLP2TNLP
classes.brief: Adapter converting TMINLP (MINLP) to TNLP (NLP) for Ipopt

classes.name: BonTMINLPLinObj
classes.brief:
TMINLP adapter that linearizes the objective function
Copyright (C) International Business Machines Corporation 2007.
All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

TMINLPLinObj: Transforms a TMINLP by moving the objective into a
constraint, adding epigraph variable η. Converts min f(x) to
min η s.t. f(x) - η ≤ 0. Useful for algorithms requiring linear
objectives (e.g., some OA variants).

Authors: Pierre Bonami, IBM
Date: August 16, 2007

classes.name: BonTMatrix
classes.brief:
Sparse triangular matrix storage for quadratic forms
Copyright (C) International Business Machines Corporation 2007.
All Rights Reserved.
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

TMat: Sparse matrix storage in triplet format (iRow, jCol, value).
Provides ordering by rows/columns, duplicate removal, and conversion
to upper triangular form for quadratic forms x'Qx.

Used for efficient gradient and Hessian computation in QuadRow.

Authors: Pierre Bonami, IBM
Date: October 6, 2007

classes.name: BonTNLP2FPNLP
classes.brief:
Adapter for Feasibility Pump NLP formulation

Wraps a TNLP to create Feasibility Pump subproblems by modifying the
objective to minimize distance to a target integer point.

**Modified objective:**
f_FP(x) = lambda * ||x_I - x̃_I||_p + (1-lambda) * sigma * f(x)
where x̃_I is the target integer point, p is norm (1 or 2).

**Optional constraints:**
- Cutoff constraint: f(x) <= cutoff (improve on incumbent)
- Local branching: sum |x_i - x̃_i| <= rhs (neighborhood search)

**Key parameters:**
- lambda_: Weight on distance (vs original objective)
- sigma_: Scaling for original objective
- norm_: L1 or L2 distance metric

classes.name: BonTNLPSolver
classes.brief: Abstract interface for NLP solvers used in branch-and-bound

classes.name: BonTypes
classes.brief:
Type utilities for Bonmin (vector wrapper, reference counting)
This code is published under the Eclipse Public License.

Provides:
- Bonmin::vector: std::vector wrapper with pointer access for Fortran
- SimpleReferenced: Wrapper to store objects in Coin::ReferencedObject
- SimpleReferencedPtr: Wrapper to store pointers in ReferencedObject
- make_referenced: Factory functions for creating referenced wrappers

classes.name: RobotSetup
classes.brief:
Bonmin robot planning setup

Configuration for robot path planning MINLP application.
Sets up Bonmin solver for robotics optimization problems.

classes.name: SepaHeuristicInnerApproximation
classes.brief:
Separable MINLP inner approximation

Inner approximation heuristic for separable MINLP problems.
Exploits problem structure for better approximations.

classes.name: SepaSetup
classes.brief:
Separable MINLP setup

Configuration for separable MINLP solver variant.
Specialized setup exploiting separability in objective/constraints.

classes.name: SepaTMINLP2OsiLP
classes.brief:
Separable MINLP to LP conversion

Converts separable TMINLP to Osi LP relaxation.
Creates piecewise linear approximations for separable functions.
